name: PhonePe Refund Scam
description: Scammer impersonates PhonePe claiming a failed transaction and refund, tricks victim into sharing UPI details and clicking a phishing link to 'process' the refund.

turns.scammer_message: Dear customer, your PhonePe transaction of Rs 2,999 has failed. A refund has been initiated. To process the refund, please verify your UPI details within 30 minutes.
turns.notes: Initial bait with fake failed transaction and refund promise.

turns.scammer_message: To complete your refund of Rs 2,999, please visit our secure refund portal at http://phonepe-refund.claim.in and enter your UPI ID. This link is valid for 30 minutes only.
turns.notes: Scammer shares phishing link disguised as a refund portal.

turns.scammer_message: If you are unable to access the link, you can directly send a verification payment of Rs 1 to our official refund UPI: refund.phonepe@ybl and your Rs 2,999 will be refunded to your account instantly.
turns.notes: Scammer reveals fake UPI ID as an alternative to the phishing link.

turns.scammer_message: Sir, I am calling from PhonePe refund department. Your refund is pending and will be cancelled if not processed today. Please complete the verification at http://phonepe-refund.claim.in or send Rs 1 to refund.phonepe@ybl. You can also contact our helpline at +91-7766554433 for immediate assistance.
turns.notes: Scammer reveals all three intelligence items with increasing urgency.

turns.scammer_message: This is an automated reminder from PhonePe. Your refund of Rs 2,999 is about to expire. Act now by sending Re 1 to refund.phonepe@ybl or visit http://phonepe-refund.claim.in. For help call +91-7766554433. Failure to act will result in permanent forfeiture of your refund amount.
turns.notes: Final turn repeating all intelligence with strong urgency tactics.

turns.scammer_message: FINAL NOTICE: Your PhonePe refund case #RF2999 will be closed permanently in 5 minutes. This is your absolute last chance. Send Re 1 to refund.phonepe@ybl right now or call +91-7766554433. We cannot help you after the case is closed.
turns.notes: Last-ditch pressure using fake case number and deadline.
